humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a measurement of the largest tumor, which is 3 cm in diameter. According to the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less, and T3 tumors are more than 5 cm. Since the tumor size is greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, the T stage is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The primary tumor measures 3 cm in diameter, which falls under T2 classification in the TNM staging system for cancer. T2 is defined as a tumor that is 2-5 cm in size. The presence of multifocal tumor and extensive lymphatic channel invasion do not affect the T stage, only the size of the primary tumor is considered for this stage.
